subject: Sleep
title: Trauma and Sleep Architecture
description: A quick, practical guide to Trauma and Sleep Architecture.

hook.text: PTSD doesn't just cause bad dreams. It rewrites the entire blueprint of how sleep is structured.

buildup.text: PTSD patients show reduced deep sleep, fragmented REM, and increased light N1 sleep throughout the night.

discovery.text: The ratio of N3 to N1 sleep inverts. Where deep sleep should dominate, shallow sleep takes over.

twist.text: This altered architecture persists for years after the traumatic event, even when daytime symptoms improve.

climax.text: Effective PTSD treatment gradually normalizes sleep architecture, which researchers track as a recovery biomarker.

punchline.text: Trauma doesn't just haunt your dreams. It reshapes your entire sleep.

quiz.question: How does PTSD change sleep architecture?
options: Deep sleep decreases and light N1 sleep increases
